name: places/ChIJycgv-8JZwokRXpS53T_wMT8
formattedAddress: 333 E 38th St 4th Floor, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 333 E 38th St 4th Floor, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text:
Wish I can give him NO stars. Never met a more unpleasant and unprofessional doctor.
Dismissed all my symptoms, never followed the correct protocol and informed me that I would heel on my own. Thank God I chose to go with a different and knowledgeable professional and ended up with a much needed surgery. If you care about your health, stay far away from this clown. He’s shouldn’t be a doctor, he’s a disgrace to his profession. The medical board should take away his license to practice. He’s more fit to work in the circus.

originalText.text: I injured my elbow in January and believe I developed tennis elbow from my elbow to just below on my forearm. I  booked an appointment on-line with Dr. Kwon based on the fact that his webpage said he dealt with tennis elbow. I wrote in my description that I was experiencing pain in my upper forearm. Nobody confirmed my appointment. I called the day before to confirm, and was told by his receptionist that the doctor only treats from the shoulder to the elbow. This does not appear on his webpage. Nobody called me to tell me this in the two weeks since I made the appointment. The receptionist refused to understand why I was so upset and just said the doctor wasn't responsible for what's on his page (yeah, still a problem) and wouldn't apologize for the fact that I wasted two weeks of my time, almost wasted my time by going in, and would now have to be in pain for a few more weeks until I can find another doctor. I realize I was upset, but the receptionist just made it worse by not acknowledging the issues and my poor treatment. Apparently she hasn't experienced constant pain. Highly inefficient office, to the point where it borders on inadvertent cruelty. Google should let you leave no stars.

originalText.text:
Had a full thickness rotator cuff tear and the muscle had started retracting. Saw Md Kwon and had surgery shortly after.

Less than a year later and I have full range of motion, no pain, and can bench more than ever.

Trust this surgeon’s prowess and ability.
